name: CodeThreatSASTAnalyze
description: Connect to CodeThreat API and Start Scan for specified project
author: codethreat

inputs.name: CodeThreatService
inputs.label: CodeThreat Service Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the CodeThreat endpoint for your project. To create one, go to your **Project Settings**, then **Service Connections** and create a new CodeThreat Service Endpoint, you will have to enter your CodeThreat account token.
 If you are on the build pipeline classic editor, click on the Manage link to be redirected to that page.

inputs.name: organization
inputs.label: Organization
inputs.helpMarkDown: The CodeThreat codethreat unique key, i.e. `codethreat.organization`

inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The CodeThreat project unique key, i.e. `codethreat.projectKey`

inputs.name: MaxCritical
inputs.label: Max number of critical
inputs.helpMarkDown: If there are more findings than the critical value you specified as a result of the scan, the pipeline will fail.

inputs.name: MaxHigh
inputs.label: Max number of high
inputs.helpMarkDown: If there are more findings than the hgih value you specified as a result of the scan, the pipeline will fail.

inputs.name: ScaMaxCritical
inputs.label: Max number of critical for sca
inputs.helpMarkDown: If there are more findings than the critical value you specified as a result of the scan, the pipeline will fail. FOR SCA

inputs.name: ScaMaxHigh
inputs.label: Max number of high for sca
inputs.helpMarkDown: If there are more findings than the high value you specified as a result of the scan, the pipeline will fail. FOR SCA

inputs.name: WeaknessIs
inputs.label: Weakness Is
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the weaknessIs values ​​you specified come out as a result of the scan, the pipeline will fail.

inputs.name: Condition
inputs.label: Condition
inputs.helpMarkDown: A condition for Critical,High and weaknessIs values. If you want them all together use AND if you don't want OR

inputs.name: PolicyName
inputs.label: PolicyName
inputs.helpMarkDown: Policy name is used to specify which policy the scan will be performed according to. For example, Advanced Security, SAST Scan, SCA Scan, etc. By default Advanced Security.

inputs.name: SyncScan
inputs.label: SyncScan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Starts the scan, and if you don't want to wait for the result, mark it as false
